payload.content: A 100-trillion-token study by OpenRouter and A16Z indicates a paradigm shift in real-world LLM interactions towards reasoning models and increased tool invocation.

name: A 100-trillion-token study by OpenRouter and A16Z indicates a paradigm shift in
content: A 100-trillion-token study by OpenRouter and A16Z indicates a paradigm shift in real-world LLM interactions towards reasoning models and increased tool invocation.

payload.content: Programming has become the dominant consumer of tokens in LLM interactions, increasing from approximately 11% to over 50% of total token consumption.

name: Programming has become the dominant consumer of tokens in LLM interactions, incr
content: Programming has become the dominant consumer of tokens in LLM interactions, increasing from approximately 11% to over 50% of total token consumption.

payload.content: Roleplay and creative dialogue are the primary uses for open-source LLMs.

name: Roleplay and creative dialogue are the primary uses for open-source LLMs.
content: Roleplay and creative dialogue are the primary uses for open-source LLMs.

payload.content: Open-source models, particularly those from China, have significantly increased their market share and are now used alongside closed models, with open-source models often serving high-volume applications and closed models serving high-value applications.

name: Open-source models, particularly those from China, have significantly increased
content: Open-source models, particularly those from China, have significantly increased their market share and are now used alongside closed models, with open-source models often serving high-volume applications and closed models serving high-value applications.

payload.content: The coexistence of open-source and closed models is driving the adoption of routers and wrappers for efficient model routing and persistence.

name: The coexistence of open-source and closed models is driving the adoption of rout
content: The coexistence of open-source and closed models is driving the adoption of routers and wrappers for efficient model routing and persistence.
